sentence: Led by gains in the retail and energy sectors, the benchmark indices set new record highs on Tuesday.
Dow component stocks Walmart ( WMT ) and Home Depot ( HD ) are leading advancers after both beat Q4 EPS and revenue expectations, setting the retail sector of the S&P 500 up for a near 1% gain.
Bullish quarterly results from the retail sector offset a miss on the purchasing manager's indices for both the services and manufacturing sector.
The flash February services PMI fell to 53.9 from January's 55.6, missing 55.8 estimates.
The manufacturing index dropped to 54.3 from 55.0 previously, below the 55.3 projections.
